What is the difference between WordPress Posts and Pages?

answers.answer_a: There is no difference between Posts and Pages.
answers.answer_b: Posts are entries listed in reverse chronological order on the site homepage and Pages are static and are not listed by date.
answers.answer_c: Pages are entries listed in reverse chronological order on the site homepage and Posts are static and are not listed by date.

quizlists.question: Which among the following have the maximum available bytes?
How to convert a category into a tag?

answers.answer_a: WordPress provides you an option to change category into tag and tag into a category. For this, you need to install Categories and Tags Converter from the Export option under Tools section.
answers.answer_b: WordPress provides you an option to change category into tag and tag into a category. For this, you need to install Categories and Tags Converter from the Import option under Tools section.
answers.answer_c: WordPress provides you an option to change category into tag and tag into a category. For this, you need to Uninstall Categories and Tags Converter from the  Import option under Tools section.

quizlists.question: How many containers can run per host?

answers.answer_a: There can be as many containers as you wish per host. Docker does not put any restrictions on it.

quizlists.question: You have lost access to your admin area and can't recover it with email. What do you do?

answers.answer_c: Install a plugin to recover your password.
answers.answer_d: Add a new user with admin privileges in MySQL.
answers.answer_e: Reset the password of your user through MySQL.
answers.answer_f: Register a new user and set it as an administrator via your panel.

quizlists.question: Which of the following is correct about constants vs variables in PHP?

answers.answer_a: There is no need to write a dollar sign ($) before a constant, where as in Variable one has to write a dollar sign.
answers.answer_b: Constants cannot be defined by simple assignment, they may only be defined using the define() function.

Which of the following statements are true about SQL injection attacks?

answers.answer_a: Wrapping all variables containing user input by a call to mysql_real_escape_string() makes the code immune to SQL injections.
answers.answer_b: Parametrized queries do not make code less vulnearable to SQL injections.
answers.answer_c: SQL injections are not possible, if only emulated prepared statements are used.
answers.answer_d: Usage of later versions of MySQL, validation, and explicit setting of the charset of user input are valid measures to decrease vulnerability to SQL injections.

quizlists.question: A systematic collection of data stored in a central location is known as?
What is Hypervisor?

answers.answer_a: A hypervisor is a software that makes virtualization possible. It is also called Virtual Machine Monitor.
answers.answer_b: A hypervisor is a hardware that makes optimization possible. It is also called Virtual Machine Monitor.
answers.answer_c: A hypervisor is a software that makes optimization possible. It is also called Virtual Machine Monitor.

What is Docker Swarm mode?

answers.answer_a: A swarm is the name of the latest Docker release
answers.answer_b: A swarm is a group of machines that are running Docker and joined into a cluster
answers.answer_c: Docker swarm is also known as Docker Hub
answers.answer_d: Docker swarm is a tool for managing your CI/CD pipelines

quizlists.question: What are the responsibilities of a node controller?

answers.answer_a: To assign a CIDR block to the nodes
answers.answer_b: To monitor the health of the nodes
answers.answer_c: To maintain the list of nodes
